architect-shift-story.text: The Old Way. Imagine building a house. In the old days, you had to make every brick by hand, one by one. It took forever! Coding used to be the same—every line written manually.
Machines Help. Then machines came along that could make bricks faster. Frameworks and libraries helped programmers reuse code. But you still had to stack every brick yourself.
AI Assistants Arrive. Now imagine you have a super-smart robot helper. You tell it: Build me a wall here, make it 10 feet tall, paint it blue. And it does it!
Tools Like Cursor. That's what AI coding tools like Cursor do for programmers. You describe what you want, and AI helps you build it. You don't have to type every single line of code!
You Are the Architect. You're no longer just a brick-stacker—you're an architect who designs and directs. Your job isn't to type fast. Your job is to think clearly and communicate well.

evolution-story.text: The Stone Age. In the Stone Age of computing, programmers used punch cards. They literally punched holes in cards to give instructions. One mistake meant starting over!
The Bronze Age. The Bronze Age brought real keyboards and screens. Programmers could finally type code and see it immediately. Still slow, but a huge improvement!
The Iron Age. The Iron Age introduced frameworks—pre-built toolkits that handled common tasks. React, Django, Rails—these let developers build faster than ever.
The Age of Architects. Right now, we're entering the Age of Architects. This is an exciting time! Programmers who learn to work with AI will build amazing things faster than ever before.
Your Opportunity. You're learning at the perfect time! The rules of programming are changing, and those who adapt will have superpowers. Welcome to the future.

new-skills-story.text: Skills That Faded. Some skills used to be essential. Memorizing every command. Typing super fast. Writing every line by hand. Remembering tiny syntax details. These still help, but they're less critical now.

Understanding Deeply. The first new superpower is understanding how things work. When you truly understand the concepts, you can guide AI to build the right solution, even if you don't remember exact syntax.
Communicating Clearly. The second superpower is explaining what you want. The clearer you describe your goal, the better AI can help you. Vague instructions give vague results!
Reading Code Critically. The third superpower is reading and checking code. AI generates code, but you must review it. Understanding what code does is more important than writing it from scratch.
Planning with Diagrams. The fourth superpower is drawing diagrams to plan. Before you build, sketch your ideas. Flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and box diagrams help you and AI understand the goal.
The Modern Programmer. The best programmers aren't the fastest typists. They're the best thinkers and communicators. Master these four skills, and you'll thrive in the Age of Architects!
